summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons employee, a general maintenance worker at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances in August 2019. The witness is questioned about her role, knowledge of camera system issues at the MCC around the time of Epstein's death, and her interactions with other staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose death in August 2019 is the subject of the OIG investigation. The witness confirms he was housed at the MCC in July and August 2019.

persons.name: Brianna Rose Burton
persons.context: Identified as the transcriber of the interview in the certificate at the end of the document. Not a participant in the interview.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Nine South Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The media reported he died by hanging.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Employee
events.description: DOJ Office of the Inspector General agents conduct a voluntary sworn interview with a BOP general maintenance employee at the MCC as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Report of Camera System Drive Failure
events.description: A comtech reported having two bad drives on the NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR (camera recording system) and was advised to get replacement drives.

events.title: Cameras Not Recording in SHU
events.description: Half the cameras in the MCC, including all or nearly all cameras in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), were reportedly not recording.

locations: Nine South (Special Housing Unit/SHU at MCC)
keyFacts: The interview is part of the official DOJ OIG investigation (Case #2019-010614) into the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.
The BOP employee witness worked as general maintenance at the MCC and had seen Epstein in the Nine South SHU but had no direct interactions with him.

The witness stated she was unaware of any problems with the MCC camera system on or around August 9-10, 2019, and had not been informed of such issues by the communications technician responsible for cameras.

Agents referenced a technical report indicating camera system drive failures on August 8-9, 2019, and that the technician lacked access to replace drives and proper shutdown corrupted the video database.
The witness's knowledge of Epstein's death came solely from media reports, and she claimed no one at the MCC discussed the incident with her afterward.
